info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 10 at 11:39AM EST until November 11 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
info.description:
* WHAT...Lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 inches or more will be possible in the heaviest snow bands.
* WHERE...Huron County.
* WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight.
* IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, may be slick and hazardous. Plan on possible slippery road conditions during the Monday evening timeframe.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect banding is expected to be highly variable across the county. Snowfall rates in excess of 1 inch per hour will be likely within any heavy banding activity. With air temperatures below freezing, roadways may remain slippery throughout the afternoon and evening. Lake effect snow banding may shift to areas east of Port Austin to Harbor Beach this evening.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. You can obtain the latest road conditions from the MDOT Michigan Drive Map.
During lake effect snow, the weather can vary from bands of locally heavy snow to dry weather just a few miles away. Visibilities can also vary greatly. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather, visibility, and road conditions.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT
